website_summaries.verdict: Quick and easy to install. The baking soda really seemed to improve the air quality and atmosphere of the vehicle cabin.
pros: Baking soda and carbon help to filter out unpleasant odors
Some find it to be sturdier than the original OEM filter
Removes up to 98% of dirt, dust, pollen, and allergens from entering your vehicle
cons: A little pricey, but you're saving a lot compared to having the dealership replace it

customer_reviews.title: Less Noise, More Air - Finally,Gush of Fresh Air
customer_reviews.text: After installation, I experienced cabin air gush (running the AC fan full speed) I have not experience since having the vehicle 7 years ago. I can actually feel the air gush in my face sitting relaxed back-to-seat (running A/C fan full speed). However, from the dirt in the filter, I conclude the filter has never been changed since original 10 years ago (See the pictures). BTW, I never know there was filter underneath the dash - I found this out from Amazon recommendation (Thank you Amazon! Where has my mechanics being - they never mentioned the filter!?)
customer_reviews.author: RDUMan

customer_reviews.title: Not OEM quality.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the pic the factory filter has many more pleats, 44 compared to 28 for the Fram. it was also a different material and I question whether it filters as well as the factory unit, I suspect it doesn’t. Also the Fram has the airflow arrow on the side of the unit instead of the front. This could confuse some installers since this unit isn’t a square, it’s about 1/3” longer in one direction which is tough to tell until you try to put it in the slot. The direction arrow being on the side of the unit could be confusing to some. I’ll be buying the OEM unit next time.
customer_reviews.author: PK Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work just fine
customer_reviews.text: This filter does not have as many pleats as the factory filter had, but it seems to be working well. It's only been in use for about a hundred miles so there's no way to evaluate longer term performance at this time. I'm banking on the Fram reputation for quality. At this point I'd buy this filter again next time it needs replacement.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good odor free filter
customer_reviews.text: This works just like you'd hope. It filters odors and allows air to move freely. It's hard to say for sure that odors are getting filtered out, but I haven't smelled skunks, manure, or the old car up the road since I installed it. Sometimes there is a very mild, neutral odor. I suspect this is the carbon and baking soda filtering out a more putrid odor. This filter has few folds than the genuine Honda filter it replaced, but is thicker, too. I was concerned at first, but it doesn't seem to impact airflow. This is a good buy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Never ever pay for a shop to replace your cabin air filter! It is soo incredibly easy to do on your own. On most Hondas, like my 2013 accord the cabin air filter is located behind the glove compartment. Simply empty everything out of the glove compartment and then squeeze on the sides to fold it down out of the way. There is then a tray that holds the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Honda Civic
customer_reviews.text: literally put this filter in while waiting for a take out pizza. just pinch the sides of the glove box to get it to fold down. My old filter was filthy. I noticed almost immediately that my car was less "stuffy" and the defrost worked quicker. I typically only use K&N air filters but i don't like them for cabin filters because of the oil smell. I'll be coming back to Fram for under $10 I will probably replace once a year
customer_reviews.author: Nessa

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install in Under 5 Minutes! Fresh smelling air too.
customer_reviews.text: The FRAM cabin air filter was extremely easy to install. The mechanic wanted to charge quite a lot to install it. It took me under 5 minutes. The instructions that came with the filter were perfect! My old filter was so gross! Now that I have the FRAM, the air is definitely better in my car. The price was right too! Very affordable compared to other brands that are pretty much the same. I highly recommend this cabin air filter!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: WAY cheaper than the dealership and most of the time spent on the installation is spent on cleaning out your glovebox! I have a 2016 Honda CR-V and the dealership wanted I believe $54 to change this and it seriously takes less than 5 minutes to clear out your glovebox, push in the sides and drop the box, undo a clip and take off the cover, pull out the old filter, put this in, and put everything back!! There is no oder to this either, my wife was worried that she might not like it because she is sensitive to smells but there is no oder and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McBride

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY IT FOR 2016 odyssey.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy it for 2016 odyssey. Despite it state fit on 2016 odyssey. It is NOT. It is off by 1/16”. You could squeeze in but it is not fit. what the purpose using a air filter when the air just flow thru the gap. The other thing is there is a slit for the end filter at the housing. The old filter has the last fin down but this one is missing the last fin.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jen

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit (1/8th inch too small) and value (40% less total filter area) for 2016 Honda CRV
customer_reviews.text: For 2016 Honda CRV. Poor fit and value. $6 return shipment cost makes it not worth returning. The filter is 1/8th inch narrower than OEM so it doesn't fit snug and can rattle and allow some air to go around or make noise while driving. It has almost 40% less total filter area with only 27 pleats compared to OEM which has 44. Less total filter area means filter won't last as long and clog sooner. To be fair, this filter is thicker with carbon particles so can't fit as many pleats as OEM. Overall not a good value with less total filter area if you don't need the carbon.
customer_reviews.author: jfisher

customer_reviews.title: 3 minutes to change the filter. Saved myself $35.
customer_reviews.text: The local quick-lube wanted $45 to change the cabin air filter. Got the filter here, dropped the glove box. opened the air filter housing and replaced the filter, snapped the glove-box back into place and connected the little assist arm. 3 minutes start to finish. I was surprised how much crud was trapped in the folds of the filter. Just do it. You'll breathe easier! (And for those who don't want to take my word for it, the Fram website has a 3 minute video that shows exactly what I just said.)
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Acura TL perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The reason I liked this cheaper Fram filter is that it's not as constrictive as other more expensive cabin filters are. You can try to get every micron of debris filtered out of the air in your car, but I wanted to prioritize air flow and low wear-and-tear on my blower motor. I think this product is perfect for this. It'll get all the big stuff out of the air, but still flows enough that it won't decrease your air output and won't put unnecessary load on your blower.
customer_reviews.author: David Wetherbee

customer_reviews.title: Easy Do-it-yourself Product
customer_reviews.text: Installing the cabin air filter was not hard on my Honda Pilot. In my car, it was just a matter of emptying the glove compartment, depressing the little keepers on each side of the glove box to allow it to drop open fully, and removing a cover behind the glove box. Just reverse the process once the filter is in. The only thing that can be tricky is knowing the right orientation and air-flow direction for the new filter. Look carefully at the old filter before it comes out of the plastic tray housing and note the airflow direction before installing the new one.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Great filter & super easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and incredibly easy to install! I received this product a lot earlier than anticipated and was pleased to see it was in great condition. I looked up a "how to" video on YouTube on how to replace the filter for my specific car and overall it took me two minutes. My old filter was long overdue for a change. I turned on my air conditioning and I could SMELL the difference! It was filthy before with a gross mildewy smell. But after this new filter was installed, the air smelled fresh and clean! It even felt clean! I highly recommend! Will update in a few months to let everyone know how it's working!
customer_reviews.author: Marceline

customer_reviews.title: FRAM CF10134 Cabin Air Filter
customer_reviews.text: I was able to easily install this product in my Honda CRV. It does seem to be made of high quality material. Please see posted pictures. I do not believe the dealership where I purchased the vehicle changed the cabin filter because it was very dirty; since the material is gray, it is difficult to actually see how dirty it is unless you see it in person. In the posted pictures, the filter on the left is the old filter. Both sides were gray, but the new filter has a gray and white side. The product is labeled so that you know how to install it.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect filter to get fresh, clean & odor free air
customer_reviews.text: Below are the pros and cons based on my usage: PROS: - Perfect fit - Easy to install - 3 minutes tops - Charcoal/baking soda nice added feature, which really helps in eliminating odor CONS: - None that i can think of
customer_reviews.author: Nexus

customer_reviews.title: Direct Fit for 2014 Acura MDX
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying this for my wife's vehicle. Easy replacement and it doesn't require any tools so if you're not so handy with a wrench, it's ok! Build your confidence a little bit by doing this yourself. Combine this with the engine air filter and for $33 and about 7 minutes of your time, you'll save $120-$150 at the dealership. Simply tell them you don't need the filter service when they ask.
customer_reviews.author: MooseHouse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a 2018 Honda Accord
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cabin air filter for a 2018 Honda Accord. At 18k miles my filter was dirty beyond belief which seems crazy for a newer car. Anyways, it's extremely easy to swap out. The dealership charges about $75 to do this. Make your wallet happy and do it yourself in minutes. Youtube has a video for the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Ehsen

customer_reviews.title: it's just ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my stock cabin filter. I was willing to pay more since it fresh and I thought it would make my truck smell a little bit better , a little fresh and get rid of some of the funky smells in my truck but that was not the case. to be honest with you, it did not provide anything better than a cheaper one. For fitment, it's fine, perfect fit, installation was super easy.
customer_reviews.author: The Don

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my 2013 Honda Civic
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my 2013 Honda Civic. I am on my second filter. No fragrance. I think everyone is a little surprised the first time they learn that they will be installing this through their glove compartment; they are also surprised how easy it is. It will force you to empty your glove compartmwnt. Make sure to note the air flow direction as you are removing your old filter and replicate the direction with your new filter. Minimal allergy issues in cabin when using this filter -- yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Switchblade McGuilicutty

customer_reviews.title: Do this yourself!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 2014 Honda Odyssey, dealer service had quoted air cabin filter replacement at around $70 which seemed outrageous. Sure enough, arrived on time, instructions were clear and precise, and the filter replacement took all of three minutes. Simply drop down the glove box and the case for the replacement filter is right behind it, slide it in and close it up. No tools required, just push in the back sides of the glove box to bend around the stops, undo the plastic retaining arm, slide out the tray, and observe the airflow direction of the existing filter (I believe it was down toward the floor) when replacing. Perfect fit. Will never have a dealer replace this.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 2013 Honda Civic just fine
customer_reviews.text: I know little about auto maintenance and tend to leave it to the pros. When the local dealership (more aptly nicknamed "stealership") quoted me $140 just to change the air and cabin filters, I was shocked. So I looked up a video on how to change them on my 2013 Honda Civic and was relieved to find it was so easy. Changing both took me less than 5 minutes, and no tools needed. The dealer ripoff on these is outrageous. This filter has been in for about 2 months now and all seems fine. I will definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Longtime Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: My local Hyundai dealership said it would be over a $100 to replace the engine air filter and close to $200 for the cabin air filter. Ha! I went on Youtube and found a how to video for installing the cabin filter in my Sonata. Very easy. The FRAM air cabin filter slid right in with no issue. Will purchase again in the future. I don't live in a big city so not sure how much it will help with smells, but given how dirty the last one was I'm happy I replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Bound

customer_reviews.title: Works great, though it is a tight fit into my 2012 Honda Civic LX Sedan
customer_reviews.text: I like this air filter as it seems way more skookum than the cheap air filters that Valvoline installs in your car, BUT the edges of the filter are not as reinforced as I would like, inserting this air filter into my 2012 Honda civic I found that I had to apply quite a bit of pressure and the edges deformed a bit ...though once fully installed there were no air gaps between the sides of the filter housing and the Fram air filter.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Carbon filters have cleaner air.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cabin filter to replace In my car. The carbon version seems To have a cleaner smell than standard ones. So far working well.
customer_reviews.author: Glorious Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Reliable filter
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for 2016 Acura MDX . For that vehicle, disregard instructions that come with the filter. They are inapplicable. Just pull small door and panel INSIDE glove compartment, pull out tray with old filter and replace filter. First time, about 15 minutes of fumbling. Next time, no more than 5 minutes. Save $60 to $80 by not going to the dealer. Filter itself is also less expensive than OEM.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: This Is Easy. Anyone Can Do It.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know there was a cabin air filter in my 07 Accord until I had Honda change my oil. Along with their usual list of inspection recommendations was this cabin air filter. Honda wanted $63.95 to change it, and I almost did, but luckily I didn't. When I got home I found the filter on Amazon for $13.47 and watched a YouTube video of where it is located and how to change it. After the filter arrived it took me literally less than 5 minutes to change.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Tommy

customer_reviews.title: no need for your mechanic to do this
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 09 Acura TSX. I have never changed one of these and did not know what to expect. my current filter was so dirty. Im thinking this was the original filter as many people never changer the cabin filter. All you need to do is open your glove box, pull of the shelf thing and then you will see the two tabs that open and pull towards you to pull off the cover. then do the same to the filter itself. pull the filter out and put the new one in, and put everything back into place. Very Easy. dont let you mechanic charge you any more to have this installed. do it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Ribeag

customer_reviews.title: REMINDER TO CHANGE CABIN  AIR FILTER. Honda CRV is EZ DO IT YOURSELF.
customer_reviews.text: Honda CRV Cabin air filter easy to change behind lower glove comp door, take out items, unclip the hinge on right side, push in sides at top of door. Filter is in a drawer that you pull out by pushing the two arrow. Check out youtube for ez instructions. This is great quality filter lasted 4 years but should have changed sooner
customer_reviews.author: LAR

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: No install instructions are included but there is a card that tells you to go to their website for the installation instructions. Once I was on their website it was easy to find the instructions and it was a breeze! Would highly recommend this, I bought it for my 2015 Honda Accord Coupe EX-L V6 MT.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy burton

customer_reviews.title: Not sure it does much
customer_reviews.text: Not sure it does much, but its pretty cheap so I change it out anyway. This is in my CRV which is my daily driver in Houston and I've never really seen dirt, dust, etc. in the old ones, so I don't know if it really does much, but for the price, I keep changing them out just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: It is a good filter
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Perfectly fits my 2016 CRV. As another review notes this does not have as many pleats as the original equipment Honda cabin filter, but I find no performance decrease. I was initially disappointed that blower noise did not decrease. However, unrelated L popped the hood and was startled by a mass of leaves present over the vents. Scooping those out, there was less blower hum at the high blower settings
customer_reviews.author: David A Ehrenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I examined the old cabin air filter and it was filthy. It was easy to access the filter and change it for a fraction of what the Honda dealer would charge. My advise is to check the filter and change it routinely
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to install in Honda Civic but I don’t see any difference in smell or anything new. It’s just as if I never changed the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Nazim Khalifa

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: Although it's the same dimensions as the stock filter, it's opposite of the stock filter so the only way it fits into the filter compartment is with the air flow label to the side instead of the front. I can't tell any difference in freshness between this one and the stock filter so I'm not sure the carbon baking soda combo is anything special. Won't buy again but will use until I need to replace my cabin air filter again.
customer_reviews.author: leigh1812

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2015 Honda CR-V, fewer pleats than OEM
customer_reviews.text: Fit is perfect on 2015 Honda CR-V. Be advised that this filter - like most other aftermarket cabin air filters - contains far less filtration material than OEM. I pulled the OEM factory filter on the car after 15k miles and replaced it with this FRAM equivalent. The factory filter had a total of 44 pleats across the "upstream" face. The FRAM had a total of only 28 pleats. Whether the added filtration capacity is worth double the price is up to you, but I won't be purchasing another one of these - going back to Honda OEM.
customer_reviews.author: copperheadclgp

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected.  Fits well.
customer_reviews.text: Works and fits better than expected. Because of constant moisture and vegetation mold can become a problem and is malodorous. Flushing the clean air intake with a diluted anti-fungal and properly cleaning the pre-air filter clean air intake resolves this issue. The filter is slightly scented and there is a noticeable improvement in cabin air quality and smell. This is now my go to cabin air filter.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself a ton of money and buy this!
customer_reviews.text: After being told I needed to have my in cabin filter changed by my dealer (and who wanted to charge me an arm and a leg to do it), I clicked right over to find this little gem. Bought it while I was waiting in the lobby of the dealership, it was at my door the next day. I then installed it in approximately 5 whole minutes. I have absolutely no skills in car maintenance so it may be quicker for some of you (lol). I have been very happy with it. I will be purchasing one again next time I need one, too!
customer_reviews.author: taximom212

customer_reviews.title: FRAM filter - delivery
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with the product, the fact tracing was easy was great, BUT for the statement it was hand delivered to me personally was not true. Deliveries have been thrown at my front door recently, I looked repeatedly til dark, no pkg. Went out this a.m. still nothing, so I looked in my mail box out at street, and the package was in mail box.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Amazon set it to be a fit for my 2014 ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazon set it to be a fit for my 2014 Honda. It's not. had to squish it in there and the deformation leave large opening on the sides. So now in the hazardous haze of wildfire smoke in the PNW, my car is all dusty and smoky inside. Ordering another filter hoping to get a fit this time.
customer_reviews.author: Jingyi Zhanag

customer_reviews.title: DIY yessssss
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let your oil change place charge you 5x more to do this for you. Watch the YouTube video and take like 4 minutes of your day to replace your filter yourself. This was great, I had a weird smell in my car every time I turned on the air/heat and after installing this filter it was gone.
customer_reviews.author: A H

customer_reviews.title: ... this in Honda Odyssey months ago and it works great. If you have never changed your filter
customer_reviews.text: I put this in Honda Odyssey months ago and it works great. If you have never changed your filter, click the "add to cart" button now. My old one was very dirty with leaves and other nasty things on it. Mold, bacteria, and pollen will hang out on the filter. Air that you and your family breaths flows through this filter. Do your family a favor and buy this filter. As far as changing it on a Honda van, watch a few youtube videos, it is not that hard to do. Maybe 15 minutes on a Saturday morning. I will be buying this product again and again. We all breath 12-20 times a minute, I want clean air.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Part no longer the same size/fit
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this same exact part for my vehicle on two previous occasions. They fit fine. This one is wider and longer, and does not fit. Unfortunately my car was in the body shop for 30 days, so I did not find out until it was too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Curlyconch

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really filter odor.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it says it blocks odor, however it doesn't. I use this in my 2019 Acura Tlx. I wanted a cabin air filter that can filter not just air but odors from outside like smoke, sewage smell and decayed animal smells. This wasn't helpful with that.
customer_reviews.author: Giz

customer_reviews.title: Cabin air filter works great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know I had a cabin air filter in my vehicle until I read through my manual, as soon as I took my old one out I knew that it was time to replace it. This new one has greatly inproved the air quality within the cabin in my car; it's easier to breathe and it smells good too. Overall I would highly recommend this air filter.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler K

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fit for 2005 Acura TSX
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cabin air filter for my 2005 Acura TSX. I looked up the needed part on FRAM's website and this was the exact same part. Except not a 100% exact fit. It was a VERY TIGHT fit into the holder. In fact, this was probably about 3-5 mm oversized. Not much but it was very difficult to get it to fit. I had to crush it a little... kinda like Cinderella's stepsisters trying on the glass shoe. FRAM's quality seems decent, but I've had trouble with their engine air filter getting to fit as well for other cars. Overall, for $14 I ain't super mad, but it was annoying at the time.
customer_reviews.author: phoreal

customer_reviews.title: What's that smell?
customer_reviews.text: Prefer this one to the other cheaper one's on amazon. Air smells better and last a little longer than cheaper brands. The paper is also less filmsy, not as nice as HVAC filters, but better than construction paper. Fits my honda civic 8th gen perfectly. I think I change mine every 6 months, basically whenever I wonder what that smell is. I'll keep buying this brand until something more sturdy comes along.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product I can tell it was well made, however, my nose is extremely sensitive nose and I can smell the Arm and Hammer. Most people don't smell it, but sometime It does bother me and I have to shut the airflow to my cabin off. I will continue to use it this time but I will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change, don't let them charge you.
customer_reviews.text: Mechanic said it needed changed when I had my AC recharged. So I looked up my car on YouTube and watched how to change it myself...ya won't charge me extra. This fit perfectly in my 2006 Acura TSX. Air does smell more fresh, the old one was nasty so much improved.
customer_reviews.author: S.LEE

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement, Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: The Honda Dealership was trying to charge me $50 to replace this filter. It's really not difficult at all to replace, which is why I don't understand why the dealership was trying to charge me that amount when I did this task on my own by looking up a youtube video. DO NOT purchase from the dealership, this will save you so much money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: 10x Fresher Air!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea what to expect opening up my cabin air filter compartment having a pre-owned vehicle. After opening it, no doubt it was DEFINITELY time to change! There was an outrageous amount of leaves and pollen and all kinds of things in the old filter! Really easy to change in my 2014 Honda Civic Si took me all of 10 minutes and most of that was because my glovebox was full of stuff. Upon putting in this filter the air seemed to be cooler and flowing about 10 times better than it was! As for the odor control I haven't been able to test yet but I recommend for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gray

customer_reviews.title: Better than new - and very easy!
customer_reviews.text: This is SUPER easy to install in a 2012 Honda CRV. The hardest part is remembering which way to place it (so be sure to make a note). Simply: 1: Remove the glove compartment (there are a few youtube videos for later/similar models). 2. Remove the cover from the black housing directly behind the glove compartment 3. Remove the old filter (note which way is up) 4. Re-install the cover and glove compartment This took me less than 5 minutes - about 10 minutes to research how to do it. Really easy. Really worth it. Air seems cleaner, perhaps even better than when it was new!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the plain filter
customer_reviews.text: The filter seems to be more restrictive on the airflow compared to the OEM. I don't feel any extra freshness of a breeze with this filter. Lots of black droppings and I hope it will not mess up my blower motor. Also I read somewhere that the baking soda might cause damage to the blower motor as well. My next filter, I would just get the plain vanilla filter with no add-on gimmick on it. Oh this is for my '08 Acura TL-S which was a PITA to install!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: If your car smells, get this and change the cabin filter fast!
customer_reviews.text: After a stretch of humid summer days intermingled with thunderstorms, the car cabin really started to smell bad (mold and urine bad). Bought the FRAM Fresh Breeze Cabin Air Filter and received it right on time (2 days Amazon Prime). Very easy to install (Acura's credit though for engineering an easily accessible air cabin filter compartment) and immediately noticed the 100% improvement. All the horrid smell was gone and I can actually smell the air freshener inside the cabin. Bottom line: next time your car smells when the air is on get this, great product in a nutshell! (Make sure you check compatibility with your year, make and model)
customer_reviews.author: buy.A.T.30.C.E.L.L.at.50

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install for instant fresh and clean air!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how much the dealership wanted to charge me to replace this after seeing how simple it is to do it yourself. I bought this filter by FRAM, knowing already that I'm getting a quality brand. I only buy FRAM for all of my vehicle filter needs. I literally removed my old filter in about 10 seconds and was amazed at how dirty it was. Popped in the new one and the entire procedure was complete in under 30 seconds. Much cleaner and fresher air now coming into the car and I'm so glad I can now easily do this myself and a lot cheaper by purchasing this on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: 49erinnc

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression is good product but......
customer_reviews.text: Initial impression is a good value. Doesn’t have as many pleats as the HONDA oem part which means not as much surface area. I don’t know if that’s a positive or negative. Also, it appears that it’s dark color will make it difficult to tell when it’s dirty and needs to be replaced. I will find out in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. lubchansky

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, but fewer pleats than OEM and more restrictive. Reduced airflow and did not help reduce outside smells at all. Didn't last long either. Did nothing to reduce diesel exhaust when following trucks. Whereas my other car (Mercedes E class) had a filter that reduced then to virtually nothing. The main selling point if this filter seems to be carbon and baking soda. Useless gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: D. K.

customer_reviews.title: Decent replacement, sizing slightly larger
customer_reviews.text: Filter material is dark, not white like OEM if that is a concern to you (see photo). My issue is the fit was not as good as OEM. It was slightly larger and required the filter to be shoved in to fit. This slightly collapsed the pleats. Not a big deal, but for such a common filter size, figured they could get the sizing right.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Breathe easy
customer_reviews.text: I was at the dealership they wanted nearly 100 to replace the air filter. I ordered this one looked at a few youtube instruction videos and ... taaa daaaa cost was a fraction of the dealership and I got a better filter also
customer_reviews.author: Trish216

customer_reviews.title: Wrong filter on site search.
customer_reviews.text: I also ordered a filter for my 2012 Honda CR-V. I entered the car details and the site took me to a Gram CFCF8791Awhich I ordered. That is the wrong filter. It is for Chevrolet Silverado truck. You better watch your back on this site.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Fits Honda and Acura models ...
customer_reviews.text: This filter fits a number of Honda and Acura models, including 2007 Accord, 2005 - 2010 Odyssey and 2014 Acura RDX. The filter fits well, appears well made and competitively priced versus other national brands. It also claims to remove odor with carbon and baking soda filtrate in the filter. While most Honda models are easy to replace the in-cabin filter, 2010 Odysseys are not so consumer friendly in terms of access. Be sure you can access them before buying the filters.
customer_reviews.author: zanypoet

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the same old one which was a little smelly after a year or More. Liv in a humid area and often close outside air due to oders and forget to turn off. Thus humidity in cabin. Changing the filter worked immediately.
customer_reviews.author: rocky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have installed this filter in a 2006 Honda Accord V-6, and it was very easy to do. If your Honda has a small black plastic rod on the right of the glove box (outside), go ahead and swing the glove box downward as instructed by pressing in on both sides. Then when it is stopped by the stop rod, just press forward on the indentation at the bottom of the rod and it will snap loose from the glove box. I find that these filters are better than the dealer-installed filters. They contain both carbon and baking soda, both of which freshen the air very effectively. Great product, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Techman

customer_reviews.title: Good filter for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had to look up a YouTube video to install this. I'm 39 y/o and never changed a cabin filter before. Thank goodness for YT! Lol. The instructions that came with the filter weren't clear enough. Otherwise, it fit my 2006 Odyssey with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brookie Q.

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fit in 2017 Ridgeline
customer_reviews.text: I had to deform the filter to get it into the frame. That resulted in puckering on the fan-fold edges. I also broke one of the installation clips on the side of the filter frame while wrestling with it. So be careful the cabin air filter frame (from Honda) is delicate and brittle.
customer_reviews.author: KWC Indy

customer_reviews.title: Filters out bad smells
customer_reviews.text: While this may not be able to completely filter out the worst smells from cooking road pizza, it does a great job in traffic. It was also easy to install and will last for a year before I need to replace it again.
customer_reviews.author: William G

customer_reviews.title: Nice filter
customer_reviews.text: Nice filter that seems to work well and it's a lot cheaper than a Honda filter. It also has charcoal in it unlike the Honda filter. It installs very easy. Just take it slow and easy to not break anything.
customer_reviews.author: Barclay's Review

customer_reviews.title: Low quality control.  Not recommeded
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two filters for my 2017 Acura MDX. Only one fit. The other one is slightly bigger and if you force it into the tray the filter bends and leave uncovered surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy Owner

customer_reviews.title: Clean Air, Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: This filter fit perfect in my 2013 Accord Sedan. While the product is made in China, I didn't see any difference from the OEM when I compared them. I'll update the review after a few thousand miles as to how the air inside the car smells. My old one looked like it had never been replaced and I've taking it to the dealer for all it's scheduled maintenance. Makes me wonder if they actually replaced it last time they charged me $70 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: R Aramis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable a dealership would charge over $70.00 dollars for a $13.00 filter. 2 minutes tops to replace.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good quality filter at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a good quality cabin filter with the active charcoal carbon. I change my cabin filters every 12-15 months and have found that using the filters with carbon do help keep the car cabin air cleaner smelling than a standard cabin filter. The cost of this filter is less than half of a carbon cabin filter at Walmart or my local auto parts store. I installed this filter in my daughters 2004 Accord with the v6 engine.
customer_reviews.author: STINK64

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the higher price
customer_reviews.text: The Bought the Fram thinking it would be better - but it wasn't. It had fewer pleats than original, I didn't see the advertised carbon (or even darker pleats), and the front / rear edges were not reinforced like original so it was hard to slide in. When removing the filter it will tear apart, unless you are very careful to hold the reinforced edges. So Fram is not worth the higher price. Might as well get cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: Retired EE

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2017 Honda Accord
customer_reviews.text: This air filter fits my 2017 Honda Accord and it smells kinda pleasant. One small complaint: it does not have 4 rigid sides like the OEM so it is a bit difficult to take back out of its place. Other than that it fits and it does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Wes B.

customer_reviews.title: Blocks air flow.
customer_reviews.text: Block air flow significantly! Especially after 5-6 months of use. Did not found it useful for filtering odors. Switched back to the original Honda filter part number "Honda 80292-SDA-407 Filter Element"
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Easy install! Do yourself a favor!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and seems to be well constructed. I just installed this in a 2007 Civic in perhaps 30-40 seconds. I spent more time picking up all the little pieces of dirt and pine straw that fell out of my old filthy one onto the car floor when I pulled the old one out than I did time actually installing the new one. I haven't used it yet to check airflow difference (or likely placebo effect) but at least installation was a breeze and the physical item seems to be as good if not better quality than the original.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: NOT US MADE-MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: Very good product,but misleading ad. The ad says origin is USA but in fact is China. Could have saved money by just buy the china made product-both probably made in the same factory. I contacted Fram regarding the air flow direction on the filter. my filter arrow directed me to install the filter with the charccoal coating on the side where air would depart from the filter. The technical person at Fram told me to place the charcoal side where the air enters and apologized for Frams misprint. They are trying to correct this.
customer_reviews.author: H Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Best cabin air filter
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to for cabin filter. I replace every 30k miles on all my cars and it’s been great. No complaints when I put it in and nothing to complain about when I remove it and examine it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. O

customer_reviews.title: The mice didn't eat it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been having issues with mice eating my cabin air filters so this was purchased as a replacement. For whatever reason, they haven't bothered this filter yet and that is about all I can ask for. I feel like cabin air filters only catch large debris so my standards for this product aren't particularly high. It is cheap, it worked, and it fit my vehicle as specified.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Saved a ton of money replacing myself vs having it replaced during oil change. Activated carbon is only a plus although you should remember to have you Air handler on recirculate to really deal with any odors in the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Changed out on a car that had been parked more than driven. The air filter is easy to install and after about 1 day could really notice a difference with the Air on.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg M

customer_reviews.title: The right product, with delivery expectations exceeded.
customer_reviews.text: Thirty bucks for a piece of processed paper seems a little high, but everybody else is doing the same thing. No matter how you cut it, it's still way more cost effective than having a dealership perform the task. The installation instructional video made the job simple. Product installed easily, and time involved was all of 15 minutes, start to finish. Seems to be functioning as advertised. Not too much else to say.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Graham

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 2018 Honda Accord like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install searching for a simple youtube video. No reason to have someone do this for you for most makes/models. Far too easy and much cheaper to do it yourself. This is the second one I've purchased. The first one filtered out all kinds of junk.
customer_reviews.author: kegstand

customer_reviews.title: Fram Quality
customer_reviews.text: The service people wanted to charge my daughter way too much to change out this filter on her 2007 Honda Civic coupe. Needless to say dad didn't charge for labor (what labor?). Cabin air filters are a cinch to change on every car I have owned. Just do it yourself and save the change...
customer_reviews.author: J.Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to change the Filter.
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced this filter on a 2012 accord (6cyl) and a 2013 accord (4cyl), it fit perfect on both cars. Air flow arrow points down for both cars. Watch any You-tube video and it should take 5 minutes, it takes longer to empty the glove box. The 2012 car had 32,000 miles on the filter and it was filthy, clogged with leaves and dirt. The 2013 had 16,000 miles on the filter and was pretty dirty. I did notice a stronger air flow thru the vents with the AC on.
customer_reviews.author: TeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, but not with their help!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install with the help of YouTube, but they include no instructions and the online ones suck. The filter itself works, is cheap, and saves a lot of hassle at the dealer or mechanics shop.
customer_reviews.author: Evan WalkerTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Works for filtering basic dust but it can't filter 18 wheeler exhaust smell!
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good at filtering air, somewhat good. If the convertible car in front of you fart, this will probably filter the smell. If a 18 wheeler drive in front of you... You can smell the cancer! Driving by skunk city or oil refinery city or marsh pit, you can smell it. The carbon filter is a gimmick, no where thick enough to filter the smell. It does filter dust and stuff like that. It remind me of engine air filter instead of a home hepa filter.
customer_reviews.author: Buggie Boo

customer_reviews.title: 2014 Honda Pilot Touring
customer_reviews.text: Pros: A little cheaper than OEM Cons: I did notice that the heat/AC has a more restricted air flow now after installing this product. I'll be going back to OEM after 6 months and I'll be sticking to OEM from now on.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lo

customer_reviews.title: Easy, direct replacement: 2006 Honda Accord.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I bought it for the price because a dealer/service station replacement costs more. Kinda like paying someone to replace your windshield wiper blades. Fram is a know brand name and the filter fit without issue. I installed this in my 2006 Honda Accord in under two minutes. No issues whatsoever; and should likely be replaced annually. You will know by simply checking.
customer_reviews.author: MGBguy

customer_reviews.title: U want better airflow? Replace ur dirty filter with this one!
customer_reviews.text: OEM fitment on my 2009 Accord EX coupe. I noticed I was hardly getting any cold AC air through my vents, I thought maybe my AC was breaking down. As soon as I replaced the old filter my AC started getting colder with more airflow. The old filter had dirt accumulated.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Tovar

customer_reviews.title: Cheap glue. Breaks down
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to stock up on filters... got it out for installation today and the sides are off. Made it hard to use/slide Useless. Stick with OEM
customer_reviews.author: DJ Flav

customer_reviews.title: fit well
customer_reviews.text: opened the glove box and pulled the shelf out to get to the filter which the hardest part of the whole deal, pulled the filter frame out removed the old filter noting where the arrow was pointing for air flow, removed old filter and the new one slipped right in. was worried it might not fit or be the right size but that wasn't the case. whole ordeal took about five minute to change out. noted much better air flow in the cabin after changing out the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It fits my 2009 Honda Civic Coupe and 2015 Honda Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: This fits my 2009 Honda Civic Coupe and 2015 Honda Odyssey, but I'm not sure how effective the "Arm & Hammer"/Carbon is at reducing or "absorbing" odors. Either way, this is an easy DIY maintenance task, NO ONE SHOULD EVER PAY A SHOP TO PREFORM THIS SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Me Tell U

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price vs stock non carboned filters for double the $$
customer_reviews.text: Fit the 09 Honda Accord 4 Dr v6 like a breeze. Paper material is thick enpugh, not too far froom oem and they didn't cheap on the carbon. Keep in mind this is the insert only so don't toss or break your original plastic frame that goes around it. Also, tip, pay attention to how you remove the oem especially the direction of air flow marked by an arrow. Install your new filter into the frame accordingly and replace again accordingly to air flow. Othwrwise, I'm happy. The vents don't shoot out vent fart like it used to. Nice bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Vance

customer_reviews.title: Cabin Filter for 2003 Honda Accord
customer_reviews.text: Bret value for a standard product. Saved $5 from the regular Walmart price! Arrived 2 days after I ordered it and most of these cabin filters are easy to change and require NO tools. Why pay the “quick lubrication business” $25-$50 to change something you can do in 3 minutes and pay less than $15?
customer_reviews.author: Berns

customer_reviews.title: Breathing clean again.
customer_reviews.text: This filter is impressive. I bought my Honda crosstour at 22k miles and haven't changed the filter until 36k miles and I love it. Never felt better in the vehicle over the last 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Thorn

customer_reviews.title: cabin filter works
customer_reviews.text: does as stated. cabin filter for the air conditioning. changed mine out from the original I got the car with (10 years ago) and it made a massive difference. air flow is much better now that I changed out the filthy one. Next time i'll change it sooner than 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: Garret Kanemaru

customer_reviews.title: Good Product and Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I compared the price of this product on Amazon to the price at a popular auto parts store and the big discount store. The price at Amazon was by far the better price. The product appears to be an authentic Fram filter and I did compare my old one to the new one very carefully. This is a good product at a great price. The product is as promised and delivered as promised. I highly recommend purchasing this Amazon product.
customer_reviews.author: JT Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fram, Cabin Air Filter.
customer_reviews.text: A good deal here for this Fram fresh breeze cabin air filter. You know the dealership will charge you twice as much for the same thing. Easy enough to replace on your own, as mine was in the glove box. (A quick tip: with a Sharpie marker, write the date on side of filter before you install) When the current filter gets dirty, I'll be back to buy another. I highly recommend this product. Have a great day.
customer_reviews.author: MegaDave

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in my 2013 Honda Pilot.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in my 2013 Honda Pilot. Appears to be great quality, but can't really tell a difference in air quality in my vehicle. It has thicker materials than the last filter I was using, which was a generic brand. The price is good through Amazon, so 5 stars is warranted.
customer_reviews.author: cylegreen

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself!
customer_reviews.text: It fits really tight like it's slightly too large. Other that that in works well. I don't know how well the activated carbon works to reduce odors but it can't hurt. Don't let the dealership replace this for you. There are videos on the internet that show you how to replace this and save big money. If you replace it yourself it's cheap enough to replace every year. Mine collects bugs and leaves so I replace it often.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in AL

product_meta.title: FRAM Fresh Breeze Cabin Air Filter with Arm & Hammer Baking Soda, CF10134 for Honda Vehicles
product_meta.description: FRAM Fresh Breeze Cabin Air Filters can keep up to 98% of road dust and pollen particles from entering your vehicle to improve your driving comfort. Plus, it’s the only cabin air filter with Arm & Hammer baking soda and activated carbon embedded in the filter media that can help remove odors flowing through the vehicle ventilation system.
feature_bullets: Filters up to 98% of dust, pollen, and other contaminants
Arm & Hammer baking soda combined with carbon cleans the outside air flowing through the ventilation system
Provides more air flow for improved performance and helps prevent musty odors from forming inside the vehicle
Keeps damaging particles from entering the engine and causing increased engine wear
Installation instructions are included in every box, along with QR codes to installation videos

specifications.Model: FRAM Fresh Breeze - Cabin Air Filter
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,851 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
